Event.name: Apply_heat
Event.definition:
<def-root>A <fen>Cook</fen> applies heat to <fen>Food</fen>, where the <fen>Temperature_setting</fen> of the heat and <fen>Duration</fen> of application may be specified. A <fen>Heating_instrument</fen>, generally indicated by a locative phrase, may also be expressed. Some cooking methods involve the use of a <fen>Medium</fen> (e.g. milk or water) by which heat is transferred to the <fen>Food</fen>. A less semantically prominent <fen>Food</fen> or <fen>Cook</fen> is marked <fen>Co-participant</fen>.
<ex><fex name="Cook">Sally</fex> <t>fried</t> <fex name="Food">an egg</fex> <fex name="Medium">in butter</fex>.</ex> <ex><fex name="Cook">Sally</fex> <t>fried</t> <fex name="Food">an egg</fex> <fex name="Heating_instrument">in a teflon pan</fex>.</ex> <ex><fex name="Cook">Ellen</fex> <t>fried</t> <fex name="Food">the eggs</fex> <fex name="Co-participant">with chopped tomatoes and garlic</fex>.</ex>
This frame differs from Cooking_creation in focusing on the process of handling the ingredients, rather than the edible entity that results from the process.</def-root>

Arg.name: Cook
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Cook</fen> applies heat to the <fen>Food</fen>.<ex><fex name="Cook">Drew</fex> <t>sauteed</t> the garlic in butter.</ex> </def-root>

Arg.name: Heating_instrument
Arg.definition:
<def-root>This FE identifes the entity that directly supplies heat to the <fen>Food</fen>. <ex>Jim <t>browned</t> the roast <fex name="Heat_instr">in the oven</fex>.</ex>
This FE will take precedence over <fen>Container</fen> when both are expressed in the same constituent. For example:
<ex>Kate <t>cooked</t> the rice <fex name="Heat_instr">in a rice-cooker</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Place
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the heat application occurs. <ex>We <t>baked</t> the cake <fex name="Place">in the kitchen</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Food
Arg.definition: <def-root><fen>Food</fen> is the entity to which heat is applied by the <fen>Cook</fen>.<ex>Suzy usually <t>steams</t> <fex name="Food">the broccoli</fex>.</ex>In instructional imperatives, this FE, which would be used for the (missing) object, is tagged CNI:<ex><t>Cook</t> on low heat for two hours.<fex name="Food">CNI</fex></ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Time
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Time</fen> at which the heat application occurs. <ex>Jim <t>roasted</t> the chestnuts <fex name="Time">in the evening</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Means
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Means</fen> by which heat is applied to <fen>Food</fen>. <ex>Kate <t>blanched</t>the broccoli <fex name="Means">by throwing it into a pot of boiling water</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Purpose
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Purpose</fen> for which an intentional act is performed.<ex>John <t>baked</t> cookies <fex name="Purp">to show Patti that he was sorry</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Duration
Arg.definition: <def-root><fen>Duration</fen> is the amount of <fen>Time</fen> heat is applied to the <fen>Food</fen>.<ex>Jim <t>boiled</t> the egg <fex name="Duration">for three minutes</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Medium
Arg.definition: <def-root><fen>Medium</fen> is the substance through which heat is applied to the <fen>Food</fen>. <ex>Bobby <t>fried</t> the potatoes <fex name="Medium">in oil</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

Arg.name: Co-participant
Arg.definition: <def-root><fen>Co-participant</fen> is the gramatically less prominent of two foods to which heat is applied by the <fen>Cook</fen>.<ex> Kate <t>baked</t> the apples <fex name="Co-participant">with cinnamon</fex>.</ex><ex>Joe <t>roasted</t> potatoes <fex name="Co-participant">with the chicken</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Temperature_setting
Arg.definition:
<def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Temperature_setting</fen> of the <fen>Heating_instrument</fen> for the <fen>Food</fen>.
<ex>He <t>baked</t> the cookies <fex name="Temp">at 350 degrees</fex> for 11 minutes.</ex> <ex>She <t>microwaved</t> the popcorn <fex name="Temp">on high</fex>.</ex> <ex>You can't <t>cook</t> popcorn <fex name="Temp">on low heat</fex>!</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Degree
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Degree</fen> to which heat application occurs.</def-root>

Arg.name: Manner
Arg.definition: <def-root>Any description of the cooking event which is not covered by more specific FEs, including secondary effects (<ment>quietly, loudly</ment>), and general descriptions comparing events (<ment>the same way</ment>). In addition, it may indicate salient characteristics of an <fen>Cook</fen> that also affect the action (<ment>presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully</ment>). <ex><t>Saute</t> the onions <fex name="Manner">gently</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Container
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Container</fen> holds the <fen>Food</fen> to which heat is applied.<ex><t>Boil</t> the potatoes <fex name="Container">in a medium-sized pan</fex>.</ex>Things that apply the heat directly are <fen>Heating_Instrument</fen>s, e.g. crock-pot, electric skillet.</def-root>

Arg.name: Beneficiary
Arg.definition: <def-root>THe person for whose benefit the food is cooked.</def-root>

lexUnit.name: braise.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: fry lightly and then stew slowly in a closed container

lexUnit.name: blanch.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: prepare vegetables for freezing or further cooking by immersing briefly in boiling water

lexUnit.name: brown.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: make or become brown by cooking

lexUnit.name: broil.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: cook by exposure to direct heat

lexUnit.name: parboil.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: partly cook by boiling

lexUnit.name: coddle.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: cook an egg in water below boiling point

lexUnit.name: scald.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: heat milk or other liquid to near boiling point

lexUnit.name: stew.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: cook or be cooked slowly in liquid in a closed dish or pan

lexUnit.name: char.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: partially burn so as to blacken the surface

lexUnit.name: poach.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: cook by simmering in a small amount of liquid

lexUnit.name: steep.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: soak in water or other liquid

lexUnit.name: toast.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: cook or brown by exposure to radiant heat

lexUnit.name: saute.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to fry food in a fatty substance

lexUnit.name: microwave.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: cook in a microwave oven

lexUnit.name: steam.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: cook by heating in steam from boiling water

lexUnit.name: fry.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: cook or be cooked in hot fat or oil

lexUnit.name: grill.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: cook with a grill

lexUnit.name: roast.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: cook by prolonged exposure to heat in an oven or over a fire.

lexUnit.name: boil.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: cook by immersing in boiling water

lexUnit.name: simmer.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: stay or cause to stay just below boiling point while bubbling gently

lexUnit.name: cook.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to prepare food by applying heat

lexUnit.name: bake.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: cook by dry heat without direct exposure to a flame, typically in an oven

lexUnit.name: barbecue.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: cook (food) on a barbecue.

lexUnit.name: deep fry.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to cook by immersion in heated fat or oil

lexUnit.name: singe.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: burn superficially

lexUnit.name: sear.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: burn or scorch with a sudden intense heat.

lexUnit.name: plank.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: cook on a plank over heat.

lexUnit.name: scorch.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to burn something lightly on the surface or edges

lexUnit.name: frying.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the process of cooking in hot fat or oil

lexUnit.name: grilling.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the process of cooking by direct heat, as on/under a grill or over a hot fire

lexUnit.name: boiling.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the process of cooking by immersing in boiling water

lexUnit.name: roasting.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the process of cooking by prolonged exposure to heat in an oven or over a fire.

lexUnit.name: melting.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the process of liquifying through warmth or heat

lexUnit.name: melt.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to liquify through warmth or heat

lexUnit.name: broiling.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the process of cooking by exposure to direct heat

lexUnit.name: toasting.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the process of cooking or browning by exposure to radiant heat

lexUnit.name: simmering.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: causing to stay just below boiling point while bubbling gently

lexUnit.name: steaming.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the process of cooking by heating in steam from boiling water

lexUnit.name: stewing.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the process of cooking slowly in liquid in a closed dish or pan

lexUnit.name: baking.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the process of cooking food by dry heat, typically in an oven

lexUnit.name: cooking.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the act of preparing food through the use of heat
